search.partialResultExplanation: You’re seeing a partial search result. Sometimes our systems are very busy — instead of keeping you waiting we return what is available at the moment.

occurrenceDownload.csvDescription: Tab delimited CSV. Only contains the data after GBIF interpretation.
occurrenceDownload.dwcaDescription: The Darwin Core Archive contains both the original data as publisher provided it and the GBIF interpretation.
occurrenceDownload.knownIssuesDescription: A part of the GBIF processing is to flag occurrences that have suspicious fields
occurrenceDownload.FossilsIncludedDescription: There are fossils among your results. That can mean species occurrences at unexpected locations
occurrenceDownload.livingSpecimensIncludedDescription: Your search includes living specimens such as occurrences in botanical and zoological gardens.
occurrenceDownload.loaderText: Please hang on while we analyze your download

issueEnum.BACKBONE_MATCH_NONE: could not be matched to GBIF backbone

downloadKey.fileNotAvailable: This file is no longer available for download
downloadKey.downloadKilled: The download request was unsuccessful. Please try it again or get in touch.
downloadKey.downloadDeleted: This file has been deleted. If you need it restored then please get in touch.
downloadKey.storageDurationTeaser: For how long will GBIF store this data?
downloadKey.apiUsageDescription: To repeat the download on todays data using the API you can use below query.

infoAboutStorage.title: We store all download files as long as possible
infoAboutStorage.paragraphA: This page will always resolve, but the file itself might be removed in the future.
infoAboutStorage.paragraphB: But what does this mean? It means that storage space and funding isn’t infinite. We strive to store all downloads forever, but prioritize downloads that have been cited.

stdTerms.name: name
stdTerms.countryNamingDisclaimer: Names of countries, territories and islands are based on the [ISO 3166-1 standard.](https://www.iso.org/obp/ui/#search)
stdTerms.nonCriticalErrorMsg: Not all data is currently available. You are seeing a partial view of the data. Try to refresh the page and please report the issue if it continues.
stdTerms.criticalErrorMsg: The system is currently not able to process your request. Try to refresh the page and please report the issue if it continues.

role.NODES_REGIONAL_REPRESENTATIVE_DEPUTY_LAT: nodes regional representative deputy latin america

countryDescription.ASSOCIATE: %s is an associate participant of GBIF
countryDescription.FORMER: %s is a former participant of GBIF

gbifLiterature.gbif_primary: GBIF as main source of data

meta.resourceDescription: Search for resources in Global Biodiversity Information Facility. Free and Open Access to Biodiversity Data.

analyticsCountry.fromDescription: Change over time in data about species from {{country}} available from GBIF.org
analyticsCountry.publishedByDescription: Change over time in the data published by institutions within {{country}} available from GBIF.org

meta.analyticsGlobalDescription: Trends in data availability on the GBIF network, 2008 to 2016
meta.eoiDescription: To prepare for publishing data through GBIF, we ask prospective new publishers to complete this online form. Before GBIF indexes your datasets, your institution must receive endorsement as a data publisher from one of the countries or organizations participating in GBIF, through a GBIF Participant node. If your country is not yet participating in GBIF, we will seek endorsement on your behalf from the GBIF community.
meta.observationTrendsDescription: A pilot to explore whether relative observation trends for species distribution within GBIF provide useful information for researchers
meta.speciesLookupDescription: Normalize species names from a CSV file against the GBIF backbone. The file is expected to be have a column called ‘scientificName’ and an optional column ‘kingdom’ and ‘id’.
meta.iptDescription: The Integrated Publishing Toolkit (IPT) is a free open source software tool written in Java that is used to publish and share biodiversity datasets through the GBIF network. The IPT can also be configured with either a DataCite or EZID account in order to assign DOIs to datasets transforming it into a data repository.

year.between: between start of {from} and end of {to}

executiveCommittee.title: Executive committee
executiveCommittee.description: The Executive Committee operates on behalf of the Governing Board when the Board is not in session and within the areas of responsibility delegated to it by the Governing Board. Among its functions are monitoring of the performance of the Secretariat in carrying out the decisions taken by the Governing Board including implementation of the Strategic Plan and the Work Programme, and management of the budget.

scienceCommittee.title: Science committee
scienceCommittee.description: The GBIF Science Committee is an advisory committee that oversees the development and progress of the GBIF work programme and makes recommendations to the Governing Board, the Executive Committee and the Secretariat. You can read its terms of reference [here.](/document/80877/current-terms-of-reference-for-the-science-committee)

budgetCommittee.title: Budget committee
budgetCommittee.description: The Budget Committee is an advisory committee dealing with various financial issues relating to the administration of GBIF funds. Among other functions, it oversees the audit of the annual accounts submitted to the Governing Board, and it provides guidance for the selection of GBIF’s auditing company. The committee makes recommendations to the Governing Board, the Executive Committee and the Secretariat. Its terms of reference can be found [here.](/document/80669/terms-of-reference-for-the-gbif-budget-committee)

nsg.title: Nodes Steering Group
nsg.description: Established in 2011, the Nodes Steering Group (NSG) consists of the chair and vice-chairs of the [Participant Node Managers Committee](/contact-us/directory?group=nodesCommittee) joined by a regional representative from each of GBIF’s six regions ([Africa](/the-gbif-network/africa), [Asia](/the-gbif-network/asia), [Europe](/the-gbif-network/europe), [Latin America](/the-gbif-network/latin-america), [North America](/the-gbif-network/north-america) and [Oceania](/the-gbif-network/oceania)). The NSG’s objectives are to formulate specific recommendations to relevant GBIF bodies based on feedback provided by Participant nodes, and to provide advice on GBIF’s annual work programmes as they relate to the efforts of GBIF nodes.

nodesCommittee.title: Node Managers Committee
nodesCommittee.description: The Participant Node Managers Committee (or Nodes Committee) is a dynamic group formed by the node managers appointed by all Participants (countries and international organizations). The committee includes three Chair positions established through voting by the Governing Board for a maximum of two two-year terms.

secretariat.title: GBIF Secretariat
secretariat.description:
The GBIF Secretariat, located at the Natural History Museum in Copenhagen, Denmark, is charged with developing, executing and reporting on the GBIF work programme. The tasks of the Secretariat include:
 - operating the GBIF portal and associated informatics
 - coordinating activities of the network related to data mobilization, publishing and management
 - monitoring data gaps and use of GBIF-mediated data for science, and
 - operating central communication and collaboration services

voting.title: Voting participants
voting.description: Countries that have signed the GBIF Memorandum of Understanding and agree to make a basic financial contribution to GBIF core funds.

associateCountries.title: Associate country participants
associateCountries.description: Countries that have signed the GBIF Memorandum of Understanding but do not make a financial contribution to GBIF core funds, and do not have a vote on the GBIF Governing Board.

associateParticipants.title: Other associate participants
associateParticipants.description: Intergovernmental organizations, international organizations and other organizations with an international scope, and economies, that have signed the GBIF Memorandum of Understanding.

gbifNetwork.title: Directory
gbifNetwork.contactUsSubtitle: Contact information for committees, members and Secretariat staff

theGbifNetwork.chartPublicationYearly: Yearly trend of peer-reviewed publications using GBIF-mediated data

form.title: title
form.howWouldYouRateIt: how would you rate its importance
form.high: essential — GBIF have no data in this area
form.medium: important — GBIF have little data in this area
form.low: it would be a nice supplement to the existing data

observationTrends.intro: A pilot to explore whether relative observation trends for species within GBIF provide useful information for researchers
observationTrends.noData: We have no georeferenced data about the selected species after year 1900
observationTrends.resultIntro: Change in relative observation frequency for the selected area
observationTrends.embedIntro: All data mediated through the {GBIF network}

repatriation.description: Data is said to be repatriated when it is published by an institution in one country but relates to biodiversity occurring in another country

location.onlyShowFlagged: Only show records that are flagged as suspicious

menu.bifaProgramme: BIFA: Biodiversity Information Fund for Asia

issueType.RECORD_IDENTIFIER_NOT_FOUND: No record identifier was found within the file
issueType.CORE_ROWTYPE_UNDETERMINED: No rowType could be found or determined
issueType.EML_GBIF_SCHEMA: The EML document does not validate against the schema
issueType.UNKNOWN_ROWTYPE: The rowType used for the core/extension is unknown
issueType.REQUIRED_TERM_MISSING: A required term for the core/extension is missing
issueType.TITLE_MISSING_OR_TOO_SHORT: The title of the dataset is missing or too short
issueType.RESOURCE_CONTACTS_MISSING_OR_INCOMPLETE: The resource creator is missing or is incomplete
issueType.DESCRIPTION_MISSING_OR_TOO_SHORT: The description of the dataset is missing or too short
issueType.LICENSE_MISSING_OR_UNKNOWN: The license can not be parsed, is not supported by GBIF or is simply missing

META_DESCRIPTOR.description: Semantic annotation describing how the data is structured (files, columns, etc)

validation.reportLocation: This report has been written to
validation.reportDeletion: and will be deleted after one month. Until then you can revisit the report at your convenience.
validation.fileHasIssues: Some issues were detected by the validator:
validation.fileHasNoIssues: No issues found in the file

errors.404: The validation job ID was not found. If you believe this is an error, please report it.
errors.400: The file could not be processed, or it may be missing if you provided a URL.
errors.413: The file is too large, to be processed by the data validator.

interpretedCounts.taxon: Number of rows with interpreted taxon

status.title: Status
status.FAILED: Validation failed. Please check the file type, or if you submitted a url, please check that the file exists on the location.

validation.indexeable: The file can be indexed by GBIF
validation.notIndexeable: The file cannot be indexed by GBIF

terms.headline: Use of cookies on GBIF
terms.description: GBIF uses cookies and the like for the purposes of statistical analysis, improving the friendliness and usability of our website, tailoring content to your interests and engaging with social media. By visiting our website, you consent to our and third party use of cookies as described in our privacy and cookie policy.

intro.title: Feedback and questions
intro.example: Help us resolve any issues by choosing which type of feedback you’re providing

content.title: Content
content.example: Such as: That page contains a typo. That species doesn’t exist. That location seems suspect. The new URL for that organization is...
content.annotate: This publisher has a website for handling feedback. We recommend using that
content.contactPerMail: Get in touch with the dataset contact

bug.title: Bug
bug.example: Such as: The search button doesn’t work. The page doesn’t load. I can’t read this because the columns overlap.

idea.title: Idea
idea.example: Such as: I want links to related genetic sequence data. Show me all the open-access articles.

question.title: Helpdesk
question.example: Such as: How do you protect data on rare species? Can you help me find all records of this species occurring in international waters?
question.description: All questions are answered by our helpdesk at helpdesk@gbif.org
question.comment: For private enquiries and non technical questions you can reach us at info@gbif.org or at communication@gbif.org for press matters.

issues.title: Content issues
issues.description: Content issues reported by other users

feedback.bugRedirect: If you believe it has to do with GBIFs processing of the record, then please fill a %s
feedback.issueTracking: All issues are visible to the public at {Github}
feedback.failure: This isn’t good — the feedback system doesn’t work. Please send us a mail or go straight to {Github}. We are sorry about the trouble.

error.USER_ALREADY_EXIST: User already exists. Please try another username or email

error.USERNAME_NOT_UNIQUE: This user name is already in use
error.LOGIN_UNKNOWN: This login isn't associated with any accounts - if you already have an account, then login with username/email and password. Or you can register a new account.
error.PROVIDER_ACCOUNT_ALREADY_IN_USE: This profile is already connected to another account
error.EMAIL_IN_USE: The email is already in use

nameUsageOrigin.SOURCE: Record came straight from source record.
nameUsageOrigin.DENORMED_CLASSIFICATION: Implicit usage from a denormalised classification.
nameUsageOrigin.VERBATIM_PARENT: Implicit usage from a verbatim parent name usage.
nameUsageOrigin.VERBATIM_ACCEPTED: Implicit usage from a verbatim accepted name usage.
nameUsageOrigin.VERBATIM_BASIONYM: Implicit usage from a verbatim basionym/original name.
nameUsageOrigin.PROPARTE: Duplicated usage from a single pro parte record.
nameUsageOrigin.IMPLICIT_NAME: Generated, missing genus or species for ‘orphaned’ lower name.
nameUsageOrigin.MISSING_ACCEPTED: Artificial accepted usage for a synonym if its missing to preserve the taxonomic hierarchy.
nameUsageOrigin.BASIONYM_PLACEHOLDER: Placeholder usage for a missing or implicit basionym.
nameUsageOrigin.EX_AUTHOR_SYNONYM: Implicit synonym based on the illegitimate ex author. See ICN article 46: http://www.iapt-taxon.org/nomen/main.php?page=art46

help.citationExplainer: Read more about literature, how it’s discovered and linked to GBIF-mediated data.
help.locationFilterWarning:
GBIF’s indexing and quality-check routines have flagged the coordinates for some records as suspicious. Would you like to filter these records from your current map view?
**Note:** you can always reset the view to see all georeferenced records by going to the ‘Location’ filter and choosing to ‘include records where coordinates are flagged as suspicious’.
help.noJavascriptEnabled: We’re sorry, but GBIF doesn’t work properly without JavaScript enabled.
help.isSplashScreen: Our website has detected that you are using an outdated insecure browser that will prevent you from using the site. We suggest you upgrade to a modern browser.
help.imageLicenseInfo: Be aware that licenses applied to images may differ from those applied to occurrence records

faq.description: These are some of the most frequently asked questions about GBIF and GBIF.org. Please contact us if your questions aren’t answered here.

phrases.defaultPageDescription: Global Biodiversity Information Facility. Free and Open Access to Biodiversity Data.

errors.413: The geometry file is too large to be processed by the data API.
